bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to William MacDonald, November 10, 1954

div1.p: Hench explains to MacDonald why he would like to gain access to James Carroll's papers.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to William MacDonald, November 10, 1954
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
$
S
E
1207-10-51
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
ROCHESTER MINN Nov 10-1954 19
Street and No. 429 MONTGOMERY
Care of or
Apt. No.____________________________Place LAUREL MD___________
To MR WILLIAM MACDONALD
div1.p:
FEBRUARY VISITED YOUR CLIENT MRS GEORGE CARROLL RHODE ISLAND AVE
REQUESTED PERMISSION MAKE COPIES PHOTOSTATS MAJOR CARROLLS MEMORANDA
YELLOW FEVER RESEARCHES CUBA 1900. MY PURPOSE TO CREDIT CARROLL
ADEWUATELY MEDICAL BOOK. DESIRE COPIES. NO ORIGINALS. YOU GAVE HER TELEPHONED
APPROVAL BUT I COULDNT STAY THEN. WILL BE WASHINGTON FRIDAY. NOW SHE CANCELS
OUR APPOINTMENT ACCOUNT ILLNESS. HAS STORED MATERIAL, VACATED HOME
VISITING SISTER MRS JAMES SHEA 10817 HOBSON ST KENSINGTON MD. CANT EXPECT
ACTION NOW BUT ERNESTLY DESIRE EXPLAIN YOU MY INTENTIONS.
APPRECIATE GREATLY YOU LUNCH WITH ME HOTEL MAYFLOWER FRIDAY ABOUT 1 PM
div1.closer:
DR PHILIP S HENCH MAYO CLINIC Sender's name and address (For reference)
Sender's telephone number
copy of original
